caption: A thrilling pulp fantasy adventure for 3rd level characters
description:
The ancient scrolls tell the tale of bright Elysium, beacon of virtue, and its fall into the worship of Rhedon, demon-god of the sea.

As punishment, one calamitous solstice night, the gods abandoned the city and let the cold waters swallow it up.

Rhedon is long dead, and now, on the eve of the century solstice, the anniversary of its fall, the moon glows amber and the City Beneath the Sea rises up from its salty grave for one cursed night.

Your arch-foe, the Corpse-Master, races through the ruins, seeking the fabled Cranberry Goblet, an artifact of legendary power, said to be hidden somewhere in the city.

You must stop him, lest his powers be increased a hundredfold. Overcome the dangers of the city, find the goblet, and stop the Corpse-Master and his lackeys once and for all, before twelve hours pass and the city drowns again with the dawn.

Follow us on:

instagram.com/reverse_ettin_games

facebook.com/ReverseEttinGames

twitter.com/ReverseEttin

and

reverse-ettin-games.itch.io

Writing, Art, and Design by:

Aleksandar Kostic aka Caustic

Writing, Editing, and Proofreading by:

Alex Bates

system.description:
A crimson elixir that gently thumps with a heartbeat.

Benefit. When you drink this potion, roll your class's hit points die. You permanently gain that many HP.

Curse. If you drink more than one Potion of Vitality in your lifetime, you must pass a DC 18 Constitution check each time or die instantly.

An unadorned, heavy goblet with a glowing blood-red halo surrounding it. Rumored to be carved from a crimson tooth of the long-dead demon-god, Rhedon.

Benefit. Works as a powerful Remove Curse spell. In addition, it can allegedly cure vampirism, lycanthropy, and even bring the dead back to life once every hundred years.

You conjure a floating skull with two skeletal hands from a humanoid corpse. This servant can guard and scout, using its clumsy hands to feel its way. It shrieks if destroyed or once its objective has been found.

text.content:
A foul stench emanates from the mushy ground of the newly arisen mire. The croaking of toads and the bubbling of sticky mud echoes in the nauseating air. Eager ravens circle overhead, hungrily searching for scraps of flesh dying in the mossy driftwood. You are ankle-deep in the muck. Your mind is on the prize, hidden somewhere within the hoary ruins of the City Beneath the Sea.

A wall of driftwood provides a natural enclosure around the city. Before reaching @UUID[.XNIhqcScxVdnGx0l]{the outer precincts} and @UUID[.PRYH5NrEybuHLd94]{the polis} the crawlers must traverse through the driftwood orchard first.

Roll a random encounter when the crawlers enter the driftwood orchard, and for each hour they spend in there.

@UUID[RollTable.WbKEPLdVwo1YT5Ff]{Random Encounters: Driftwood Orchard}

Driftwood Orchard Encounters

2d6

Details

2

@UUID[Actor.RyhI4p0bVEVVXMRP]{Sea Hag} shapechanged to an old lady stuck in mud.

3-4

[[/r 1d2]] @UUID[Actor.6s5Ofbdq13r6NneE]{Giant Electric Eels} ready to zap anyone.

5-7

[[/r 1d6]] @UUID[Actor.uuXvsUBs3XAwvMOA]{Homunculytes} scour the muck for secrets.

8-9

[[/r 1d6]] City @UUID[Actor.S0mwBSRwl4LN30um]{Zombies}, some wearing bronze bat masks.

10-11

[[/r 1d2]] @UUID[Actor.kgAenTdw8OIPRezT]{Giant Crabs} eating feebly protesting zombies.

12

[[/r 1d6]] marooned @UUID[Actor.Dct24UunFDaAzH8y]{fishermen} who seek aid. May help.

What once gleamed with a thousand splendours is now a city in ruin, blanketed in algae, barnacles, and dying corals. Its kings lie buried deep in eternity. If the proud, solemn faces of the marble statues could speak, they would tell tales of grandeur and glory. Their silent judgement leaves your curiosity unfulfilled.

The labyrinthine ruins create a barrier around the inner city. To get to @UUID[.PRYH5NrEybuHLd94]{the polis} the crawlers must go through the outer precincts first.

Roll a random encounter when the crawlers enter the outer precincts, and again for each hour they spend there. There is a 3-in-6 chance for the encounter location to be covered by knee-deep water that hampers movement.

@UUID[RollTable.DgYwjlFOnlRMur6U]{Random Encounters: Outer Precincts}

Outer Precincts Encounters

2d6

Details

2

@UUID[Actor.uwQRoOm239xaEi3n]{Water Elemental} driven mad by the Solstice

3-4

[[/r 1d4]] @UUID[Actor.pc9isTJBsOTjIeig]{Sharks} in a shallow canal that blocks your way.

5-7

[[/r 1d6+3]] @UUID[Actor.uuXvsUBs3XAwvMOA]{Homunculytes} loot the buildings. Cautious.

8-9

[[/r 1d3]] @UUID[Actor.jNepDwpMlM6DYuq5]{Sea Serpents} hunt for landlubber flesh.

10-11

Golden @UUID[Actor.ej4kuavTmRRohjod]{Giant Octopus} spewing dark indigo ink.

12

@UUID[Actor.4sscwCDzKiGbIYR5]{Siren} caught in a net. May give Conch Horn if helped.

STRUCTURES OF THE OUTER PRECINCTS

Small Houses. Made of limestone. The roof is missing. Roll [[/r 1d6]]: (1) driftwood orchard encounter; (2-3) outer precincts encounter; (4-5) @UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.rollable-tables.RollTable.Pi9nnnLeXpTKCSMY]{Treasure 0-3}; (6) amber statue [[/r 1d4*20]]gp.

@UUID[Macro.9GheS4bKuyiB13Kk]{Generate A Small House}

Large Houses. A spacious marble home with dilapidated walls. Has [[/r 1d3]] rooms. Roll [[/r 1d6]] for each room: (1) driftwood orchard encounter; (2) outer precincts encounter; (3) Corpse-Masters sightless seeker; (4-5) looted; (6) hidden cache, Treasure 4-6 (pg. 272).

@UUID[Macro.subYAA3pLaV36SEJ]{Generate A Large House}

There are three landmarks in this area that stand out from the rest.

  • The Shrine of Rhedon. A broken statue of a bat-like entity. There are barnacles on the base. If cleaned, the crawlers discover a prayer written in a rare language that says: Bow down to the winged one and avert your gaze from its sight, for its eyes will see your virtues, and its hands will grant forgiveness.

  • Bathhouse. Once full of turquoise water, now full of foul muck. Roll [[/r 1d6]]: (1-2) nest of [[/r d6]] angry Giant Frogs; (3) the Corpse-Masters sightless seeker; (4-5) Treasure 0-3, guarded by [[/r d6]] Giant Leeches; (6) Zombie stuck in the muck with a magical mace at its hip (pg. 292).

  • Sunken Ship. There are [[/r 3d6+6]] pirate Skeletons on the ship, protecting a treasure chest. Roll [[/r 1d6]] to see the contents of the chest: (1) @UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.rollable-tables.RollTable.Pi9nnnLeXpTKCSMY]{Treasure 0-3}; (2-3) Treasure 4-6 (pg. 272); (4-6) A map written in a rare language leading to a Treasure 7-9 (pg. 274).

Hearken, o fool, for you are roaming the immortal city of conquerors, warrior-kings, and god-emperors! Behold the majestic towers and marble wonders that stand the test of time. Feast your eyes upon its grandeur before its guardians devour your unworthy flesh.

Roll a random encounter when the crawlers enter the polis and for each hour they spend in there.

@UUID[RollTable.s2KjWTRQtE4oILBq]{Random Encounters: Polis}

Polis Encounters

2d6

Details

2

Stone Statue encrusted with barnacles and mud.

3-4

[[/r 1d4]] @UUID[Actor.bz9VWI0TLhgsgE7a]{Chuuls} hidden behind toppled marble pillars.

5-7

[[/r 2d6+3]] @UUID[Actor.uuXvsUBs3XAwvMOA]{Homunculytes} patrol the polis. Aggressive.

8-9

[[/r 1d4]] @UUID[Actor.V2p1dkKupiY2w9De]{Will-O-Wisps} will lure the crawlers to a monster.

10-11

[[/r 1d4]] @UUID[Actor.jDgrkoYdlcvalNko]{Otyughs} feast upon decomposing matter.

12

Marooned @UUID[Actor.t2WRDuEYsMPP6hqJ]{captain}. Mutiny survivor. Moon-mad. *Re-roll duplicates

STRUCTURES OF THE POLIS

Mansion. A grandiose house made of the finest stones with intact mosaics. Has [[/r 1d4+2]] rooms. Roll [[/r 1d6]] for each room: (1) driftwood orchard encounter; (2) outer precincts encounter; (3) polis encounter; (4) Corpse-Masters sightless seeker; (5) empty room, picked clean; (6) hidden cache, Treasure 7-9 (pg. 274).

@UUID[Macro.jZ7j0rzq5jabpare]{Generate A Mansion}

There are three landmarks in this area that stand out from the rest.

  • Library. A grand building haunted by [[/r d4]] ghosts of dead priestesses. WIS search check DC 13 to reveal [[/r 1d6]] tier 1 scrolls, [[/r 1d3]] tier 2 scrolls, and one tier 3 scroll (pg. 288). The ghosts will become hostile if the crawlers take more than three scrolls.

  • Pavillion. A beautiful colonnade of pale marble pillars encrusted with seaweed and barnacles. WIS search check DC 15 reveals a crate with a prehistoric wine bottle worth 40gp, and a @UUID[Item.53x5w3PE8KpmemKw]{Potion of Vitality}.

  • @UUID[.NFXGi16rka7fUlS6]{The Moon Ziggurat}. Towers above them all.

• The floor is slippery and full of urchins and odd-looking corals.

  • Star maps on the ceiling depict long-gone constellations.

  • Historical inscriptions in a rare language. When deciphered they reveal the weakness of the Childe of Rhedon.

• Images of religious sacrifices engraved in the pillars.

  • Walls caked with blood.

  • Well preserved corpses of the citys former residents. Lampreys burst from their bloated bellies. If touched, [[/r 2d6]] rise as @UUID[Actor.S0mwBSRwl4LN30um]{Zombies}.

• Stone altar stands in the middle of the room, a ruby cup (300 gp) resembling the Cranberry Chalice atop it.

  • The altar base has a prayer written in a rare language that says: Eat thine cruor from the grail and a heart shall beat no more. @UUID[Macro.ADLoNeqa9pDj4cxe]{Display Prayer (Area 3)}

  • Four obsidian statues of high priests point at the cup. Will wake up if the chalice is touched.

• Heavy stone door blocks the entrance to the room. STR check DC 13 to open, or decipher rare language to find the opening mechanism.

  • Stone tablet written in a rare language describing the history, weaknesses and creation of the Childe of Rhedon. The weakness of the creature is porcelain.

  • Porcelain dagger with a skeletal hand wrapped around it floats in a trapped niche. If the dagger is removed a close crawler suffers [[/r 3d10]] damage from the trap. WIS search check DC 14 will also reveal two tier 2 scrolls behind the dagger.

@UUID[Macro.wQ3cd44OyzIyjSV4]{Reveal Clergy Cells}

At last, your greed has brought you to your end. Perhaps it was folly, or the curiosity of a child. It matters not! Fall to your knees, mortal! Grovel in the shadow of the Ziggurat of the Moon. Bow beneath its blood-soaked steps! Hear the ancient rhythm of severed heads dancing down its slope. Or, turn back while you can, lest your soul be unfettered from its corporeal prison

PROMPTS

The Cranberry Goblet - Jan 1946

The City from the Sea - May 1940

The Corpse-Master - July 1925

CONCEPTION

We were thrilled to have drawn three such inspirational covers. The Corpse-Master from July 1925 immediately struck us as a perfect name for a pulp villain, & the ghostly priestess & ragged man there seemed useful, too.

The floating skull & skeletal hands from Jan 1946 looked just like the sort of wicked apparition that a guy called The Corpse-Master might summon, & of course, the Cranberry Goblet seemed like a perfect Mac-Guffin.

The cover of the May 1940 issue also seemed tailor-made for adventure fodder - a lost city beneath the sea, a giant bat-monster, a couple of small savage humanoids, and a large snake.

We also included elements from the text on the covers, both titles and blurbs. Awful Amber Doom became the name for the adventure and the explanation for why the city sank in the first place, and Lost Elysium seemed a fine name for the city itself.

The ancient scrolls tell the tale of bright Elysium, beacon of virtue, and its fall into the worship of Rhedon, demon-god of the sea.

As punishment, one calamitous solstice night, the gods abandoned the city and let the cold waters swallow it up.

Rhedon is long dead, and now, on the eve of the century solstice, the anniversary of its fall, the moon glows amber and the City Beneath the Sea rises up from its salty grave for one cursed night.

Your arch-foe, the Corpse-Master, races through the ruins, seeking the fabled Cranberry Goblet, an artifact of legendary power, said to be hidden somewhere in the city.

You must stop him, lest his powers be increased a hundredfold. Overcome the dangers of the city, find the goblet, and stop the Corpse-Master and his lackeys once and for all, before twelve hours pass and the city drowns again with the dawn.

The NPCs

@UUID[Actor.QmzldZ2KcCi54SxP]{THE CORPSE-MASTER}

Once a mortal man, dark experiments and darker magicks have twisted him into something much like a Vampire.

  • Tactics. The Corpse-Master has entered the city, carried on a palanquin by several dozen @UUID[Actor.uuXvsUBs3XAwvMOA]{Homonculytes}. The tumultuous waters have washed away his trail, and he will remain discrete as long as possible. His Sightless Seekers will scout the path ahead; he and his minions will follow. Once he reaches the Outer Precincts, he will thoroughly search each building, attempting to bend any undead he finds to his will. He may send any new recruits to harass the heroes (or other potential threats) that his Seekers discover. Once he arrives at the Ziggurat, he will proceed directly to its peak to retrieve the Goblet.

  • Agenda. A glutton both in life and undeath, he sees the City Beneath the Sea as a rich source of materiel for his experiments and thinks the Cranberry Goblet may be the key to perfecting his vile creations.

@UUID[Actor.JJiW3zVuaFb3X4Re]{THE ORACLE OF THE MOON}

Eternally bound to the place of her demise, she wanders the streets as a powerful but incorporeal spirit of vengeance.

  • Tactics. The Oracle will put to sleep any intruders that are damaging the city, and can command any living statues. Heroes who speak an ancient language may be able to convince her of their good intentions. Clerics of evil deities or those who consort with demons will be attacked on sight.

  • Agenda. She will do all in her power to protect the City.

@UUID[Actor.X0lmnAYYEkAtPpt2]{PTEOR, THE EXPLORER}

Tall gaunt man with a bushy beard and unkempt hair. The Amber Amulet glistens on his chest, matching the glint in his maddened eyes.

  • Tactics. Pteor will avoid any physical confrontation. If pushed too far or attacked, Pteor will flee.

  • Agenda. During his brief intervals of humanity, Pteor dons whatever rags he can find and wanders the city. He remembers nothing of his former life, except that it was full of adventure and derring-do. All of the inhabitants of the city, supernatural and otherwise, avoid him. He will be confused but helpful towards anyone who treats him kindly; he can provide directions, but will flee, screaming, if the moon disappears for more than a few moments.

@UUID[Actor.HOLfJGhbzr7pOUNl]{THE CHILDE OF RHEDON}

A primordial bat-like beast with leathery wings and shadow-veiled fur. Its piercing yellow eyes and frothing fangs smite courage like a thousand swords.

  • Tactics. The Childe of Rhedon will attack any invader, but it is a blunt instrument. Bright lights and loud noises will catch its attention, but once it realizes that enemies are present, it will diligently search. If badly wounded, it will retreat to its lair in the Moon Ziggurat to transform and heal, then transform again to resume the hunt.

  • Agenda. The Childe of Rhedon is bound to protect @UUID[Item.XXh9mLiTeU5biajV]{The Cranberry Goblet} at all costs. It has no will of its own. Such is the way of this curse.

• Stone niches with books turned to rot except for a single piece of vellum, written in a rare language. The vellum is a part of a prayer that says: Return the Amber Childe to its cradle, and in the darkest hour the heart shall beat once more. @UUID[Macro.bopFOmSwD3EUEPid]{Display Prayer (Area 5)}

  • Calcified skeleton of a woman rests on the bed, clutching an amber figurine worth 40 gp.

  • Fountain with a sleeping @UUID[Actor.fg9s24AhCn0korUj]{Ochre Jelly} in the center of the room. A porcelain dagger is in the fountain under the jelly.

@UUID[Macro.wQ3cd44OyzIyjSV4]{Reveal Clergy Cells}

• The walls are damaged with giant claw marks.

  • Barnacle-ridden corpses litter the room, hampering movement.

  • The amber altar glows in the moonlight. A giant prehistoric bat sleeps inside, eternally entombed in the golden stone of old. There are runes carved in rare language. When translated the words say: A new life rests under old death. @UUID[Macro.yiL8LcNaMJs1YveU]{Display Words (Area 6)} When the Amber Amulet is placed on the altar, the altar will move and reveal a lead box with the @UUID[Item.XXh9mLiTeU5biajV]{Cranberry Goblet} inside.

@UUID[Macro.UrO1EEwhs2t8wQtr]{Reveal The Pinnacle}
